messages.subject: Re: [nihonto] Are these tsuba fake ?
messages.msgSnippet: As I mentioned on CB s listserv, I suspect these may be legit. The style is correct for Bushu Ito school and the mei don t look too bad either. Can t tell
messages.messageBody:
As I mentioned on CB's listserv, I suspect these may be legit.
The style is correct for Bushu Ito school and the mei don't
look too bad either. Can't tell about the patina, it is a bit
strange, but my books on Bushu are in B&W. Even if they are
legit, they are grossly overpriced IMHO.

Rich S
------------------------------------------------------------
Richard Stein, PhD alchemyst@...

The Japanese Sword Index
http://www.geocities.com/alchemyst/nihonto.htm
------------------------------------------------------------

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: [nihonto] Are these tsuba fake ?
messages.msgSnippet: LOL, sorry about the spell check, that is supposed to say  The mei look Chiselled, not chilled Chill out dudes Rich ... From: Richard Turner To:
messages.messageBody:
LOL, sorry about the spell check, that is supposed to say " The mei look Chiselled, not chilled"

Chill out dudes

Rich
----- Original Message -----
From: Richard Turner
To: nihonto@yahoogroups.com ; nihontostudy ; token_kenkyu_kai@...
Sent: Wednesday, September 24, 2003 5:47 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: [nihonto] Are these tsuba fake ?


kinda look fresh off the press don't they, in this one, http://cgi.ebay.com/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?ViewItem&item=2559054911&category=20084
looking at the shot of the mei ( 2nd pic ) kinds of looks like cast seam around the top of the hitsu ana's. That same mei up close also looks like it's been stamped, not chilled. mmmm, not sure, be keen to hear the experts.

Rich

Both seem to have the same "mei" as well.

look carefully, they look strange !

Matt
